task_summary: Detect the milk carton, align the end-effector to its side, push it along the table by ~20 cm, then retreat and pause.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator operates on a white table with several objects: a tall white milk carton near the table center-left, bottles and cans arranged across the surface. The goal is to push the milk carton across the tabletop without grasping it. The robot must first visually confirm the target, approach and align to a side face, perform a straight push for a set distance, and then retreat to clear any contact. Movements occur above the table plane with conservative timeouts.
preconditions: Milk carton present and reachable on the table
Gripper open and above table surface
stepwise_plan: Approach and align to a pushable face with tight tolerance
Execute a 0.20 m push at 90° direction
success_criteria: Milk carton is visibly displaced along table by approximately the commanded distance
No unintended collisions with other objects
End-effector ends clear of the object
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, reattempt detection or perform a broader scan
If alignment drifts, re-align before pushing
If push stalls due to collision, retreat and try a shallower approach
task_long_description.termination: Terminate once retreat and stabilization wait complete after the push.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Vision detects the specified object on the table.
Approach the carton and align to a side face with tight tolerance.
Push the carton along the table for the commanded distance and direction.
Back off to clear contact after the push.

failure_modes: Push direction obstructed by nearby objects
recovery_strategy: Repeat detection or widen search pattern
Re-run ApproachAndAlign with the same tolerance
Change push direction or reduce distance incrementally
assumptions: The tall white rectangular prism is the milk carton in frames.
Push direction set to 90° (camera-right) based on object layout; actual table frame could differ.
A 0.20 m displacement is feasible without contacting neighbors.

expected_success_criteria: Carton clearly moved ~0.20 m along table
